Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Foundation, students describe experiences, observations, ideas and feelings about the dances they encounter at school, home and in the community, identifying what they enjoy and why.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students develop an understanding of ways their body can move.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students use play, imagination, experimentation and selected dance elements to create dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students make and share dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Level 2, students identify where they experience dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students describe where, why and how people across cultures, communities and other contexts experience dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students demonstrate expressive and performance skills and the elements of dance to improvise and create dance sequences.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students present their work to audiences in informal settings.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Level 4, students identify and describe how they use movement to create and/or make dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students recall and describe where, when, why and how dance is created and presented across cultures, times, places and other contexts including the work of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students experiment with the elements of dance when devising dances or learning dances by other artists.

Subject: Dance
Text: They apply safe dance practices, and use the elements of dance and a range of movements to communicate ideas, perspectives and meanings.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students present and share their dance work in informal and formal settings to different audiences.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Level 6, students explore the elements of dance, dance movement and structures, and explain how they are used in creating and learning dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students describe how dance is created and presented across different cultures and contexts to communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They identify how dance is used to continue and revitalise cultures, including the works of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students document their ideas and understanding of how the elements of dance are used to create dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: They work individually and collaboratively to create dance works, using the elements of dance, choreographic processes and safe dance practice.

Subject: Dance
Text: They present their dance works in informal and formal settings, identifying different audiences.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Level 8, students analyse how the elements of dance and production elements are manipulated to create dance works.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students describe ways dance works from a range of styles and across cultures, times, places and other contexts communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning, including the works of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Dance
Text: They identify and describe how and why respectful approaches are used in creating, recreating and responding to dance works.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students select, apply and demonstrate an understanding of styles and techniques in dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students document and reflect on their dance practice using dance terminology.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students manipulate the elements of dance, drawing on safe dance practices to create works that communicate ideas, viewpoints and meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They plan, rehearse and present their dance works to a range of audiences in both formal and informal settings.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Level 10, students analyse and evaluate how the elements of dance, choreographic devices and style-specific techniques are manipulated in dance they create and present to audiences and in works they experience.

Subject: Dance
Text: They evaluate how and why choreographers across contexts and cultures present and challenge ideas and meaning through dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: They evaluate how dance is used to celebrate and challenge perspectives in relation to Australian identity, including the dances of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students work individually and collaboratively to create dances that communicate ideas, perspectives and meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They document, reflect on, analyse and evaluate their own and others’ work using relevant dance terminology.

Subject: Dance
Text: They use production elements to enhance their dance making in both devised and learnt dance works.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students select and manipulate the elements of dance, style-specific techniques and choreographic devices to structure dances for audiences, adhering to safe dance practices.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students plan, rehearse, refine, present and perform dances to a range of audiences in a range of settings, both informal and formal.
